Cameras

Description

Cameras work similar to actors on the backend.

Camera Library

class library_qlabs_free_camera.QLabsFreeCamera[source]

This class documents the QLabs Free Camera.

Methods

QLabsFreeCamera.spawn(qlabs, deviceNumber, location, rotation)[source]

Spawns a camera in an instance of qlabs at a specific location and rotation using radians.

Parameters

  • qlabs (object) – A handle to the QLabs object

  • deviceNumber (uint16) – User defined unique identifier for the class device in qlabs

  • location (array[3]) – An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates

  • rotation (array[3]) – An array of floats for the roll, pitch, yaw

Returns

True if spawn was successful, False otherwise

Return type

boolean

Caution

No two device numbers can be the same for the same class!

QLabsFreeCamera.spawn_degrees(qlabs, deviceNumber, location, rotation)[source]

Spawns a camera in an instance of qlabs at a specific location and rotation using degrees.

Parameters

  • qlabs (object) – A handle to the QLabs object

  • deviceNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class device in qlabs

  • location (array[3]) – An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates

  • rotation (array[3]) – An array of floats for the roll, pitch, yaw

Returns

True if spawn was successful, False otherwise

Return type

boolean

QLabsFreeCamera.spawn_and_parent_with_relative_transform(qlabs, deviceNumber, location, rotation, parentClass, parentDeviceNumber, parentComponent, waitForConfirmation=True)[source]

Spawns a camera in an instance of qlabs at a specific location and rotation relative to the parent device using radians.

Parameters

  • qlabs (object) – A handle to the QLabs object

  • deviceNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class device in qlabs

  • location (array[3]) – An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates

  • rotation (array[3]) – An array of floats for the roll, pitch, yaw

  • parentClass (uint32) – Parent device ID (Can be found in the class library)

  • parentDeviceNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class device in qlabs

  • ParentComponent (uint32) – 0 for the origin of the parent device, see parent device class for potential additional reference frame options

  • waitForConfirmation – Wait for acknowledgement from QLabs to proceed, this is a blocking operation defaults to True

Returns

True if spawn was successful (or if waitForConfirmation set to False), False otherwise

Return type

boolean

QLabsFreeCamera.spawn_and_parent_with_relative_transform_degrees(qlabs, deviceNumber, location, rotation, parentClass, parentDeviceNumber, parentComponent, waitForConfirmation=True)[source]

Spawns a camera in an instance of qlabs at a specific location and rotation relative to the parent device using degrees.

Parameters

  • qlabs (object) – A handle to the QLabs object

  • deviceNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class device in qlabs

  • location (array[3]) – An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates

  • rotation (array[3]) – An array of floats for the roll, pitch, yaw

  • parentClass (uint32) – Parent device ID (Can be found in the class library)

  • parentDeviceNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class device in qlabs

  • ParentComponent (uint32) – 0 for the origin of the parent device, see parent device class for potential additional reference frame options

  • waitForConfirmation – Wait for acknowledgement from QLabs to proceed, this is a blocking operation defaults to True

Returns

True if spawn was successful (or if waitForConfirmation set to False), False otherwise

Return type

boolean

QLabsFreeCamera.possess(qlabs, deviceNumber)[source]

Possess a camera in QLabs.

Parameters

  • qlabs (object) – A handle to the QLabs object

  • deviceNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class device in qlabs

Returns

True if possessing the camera was successful, False otherwise

Return type

boolean

QLabsFreeCamera.set_camera_properties(qlabs, deviceNumber, fieldOfView, depthOfField, aperature, focusDistance)[source]

Sets the camera properties.

Parameters

  • qlabs (object) – A handle to the QLabs object

  • deviceNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class device in qlabs

  • fieldOfView – The field of view that the camera can see (range:5-150)

  • depthOfField – The depth of feild that the camera can see

  • aperature – The amount of light allowed into the camera sensor (range:2.0-22.0)

  • focusDistance – The focus distance that the camera can see (range:0.1-50.0)

Returns

True if setting the camera properties was successful, False otherwise

Return type

boolean

QLabsFreeCamera.set_transform(qlabs, deviceNumber, location, rotation)[source]

Change the location and rotation of a spawned camera.

Parameters

  • qlabs (object) – A handle to the QLabs object

  • deviceNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class device in qlabs

  • location (array[3]) – An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates

  • rotation (array[3]) – An array of floats for the roll, pitch, yaw

Returns

True if spawn was successful, False otherwise

Return type

boolean

Configurations

There are no configuration options for the camera device.

Connection Points

There are no connection points for the free camera device.

Constants

QLabsFreeCamera.ID_FREE_CAMERA = 170
QLabsFreeCamera.FCN_FREE_CAMERA_POSSESS = 10
QLabsFreeCamera.FCN_FREE_CAMERA_POSSESS_ACK = 11
QLabsFreeCamera.FCN_FREE_CAMERA_SET_CAMERA_PROPERTIES = 12
QLabsFreeCamera.FCN_FREE_CAMERA_SET_CAMERA_PROPERTIES_ACK = 13
QLabsFreeCamera.FCN_FREE_CAMERA_SET_TRANSFORM = 14
QLabsFreeCamera.FCN_FREE_CAMERA_SET_TRANSFORM_ACK = 15

Tip

Whatever tips

See Also:

There is a few steps to initializing a new camera in an environment:

  1. Pick a Location for your camera using the Coordinate Helper (Determining Locations) section.

  2. Copy the location and rotation desired.

  3. Use spawn or spawn_degrees to initialize a new camera. Paste the copied location and rotation into their respective places in the function desired below:
